sentence: I want to thank Neel Kashkari for launching the Opportunity and Inclusive Growth Institute and for inviting me to join the deliberations of this distinguished group today.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Reserve. It focuses on expressing gratitude towards Neel Kashkari for launching an institute and inviting the speaker to participate in discussions.

sentence: This new Institute is another great example of how individual Reserve Banks are taking the initiative in illuminating key dimensions of our work and shaping the agenda of the Federal Reserve System.1While it has long been understood that opportunity is central to the strength of America's social fabric, it is now increasingly clear that opportunity and inclusion are central to the strength of America's economy.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication or stance on the direction of interest rates or the overall stance of the Federal Reserve. It focuses on the importance of opportunity and inclusion in America's social fabric and economy, but does not provide any insight into the monetary policy stance.

sentence: I will touch on the key ways that opportunity and inclusion matter for policymaking at the Federal Reserve, ranging from our dual-mandate goal of maximum employment to our monitoring of household financial health to our engagement in low- and moderate-income communities all over the country.
reason: This sentence highlights the Federal Reserve's focus on opportunity and inclusion in policymaking, which is neutral in terms of US monetary policy. It emphasizes the importance of the dual-mandate goal of maximum employment and monitoring household financial health, as well as engagement in low- and moderate-income communities.

sentence: I will focus on how our work intersects with the groundbreaking work of the accomplished group of researchers assembled here.In the original design of the Federal Reserve, it was recognized that the American economy is not monolithic; that is why the Congress created our system of 12 Federal Reserve Districts.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the original design of the Federal Reserve and the creation of 12 Federal Reserve Districts. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: We are present in communities all across America through our Reserve Banks and Branches and their boards and advisory councils.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications regarding the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) towards interest rates or the economy. It solely highlights the presence of Reserve Banks and Branches in communities across America.

sentence: This local presence, by design, gives us valuable perspectives on how Americans are experiencing the economy in different communities around the country and critical insights about the varied challenges that lie beneath the aggregate numbers.
reason: This sentence suggests that the FOMC values the local presence as it provides valuable perspectives on the economy and insights into challenges faced by different communities. However, it does not directly indicate any stance on US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in terms of being hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence:
In turn, our local engagement helps stakeholders in these communities partner to improve opportunity and inclusive growth.Inclusion and Maximum Employment
Inclusion is an enduring goal of public policy that is embodied in our maximum-employment mandate.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the goal of inclusion and maximum employment, which is not directly related to the stance of monetary policy being hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: The Employment Act of 1946 charges the federal government with creating "conditions under which there will be afforded useful employment for those able, willing, and seeking to work, and to promote maximum employment, production, and purchasing power.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it pertains to the Employment Act of 1946, which focuses on creating conditions for maximum employment and purchasing power. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: "2 Maximum employment is inherently an inclusive goal.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It implies that the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) considers maximum employment as a goal that encompasses all individuals, indicating a focus on promoting job opportunities and inclusivity in their policy decisions.

sentence: In 1977, the Congress amended the Federal Reserve Act to make achieving maximum employment an explicit objective of monetary policy, along with stable prices.
reason: This sentence highlights the Congress' amendment to the Federal Reserve Act in 1977, which added the objective of achieving maximum employment to monetary policy, alongside stable prices. It is irrelevant to the current stance of US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of whether it is hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: In fulfilling its dual mandate, the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) has set a target of 2 percent for inflation but does not have a similarly fixed numerical goal for maximum employment.
reason: This sentence implies that the FOMC has a hawkish stance on inflation, as it has set a specific target of 2 percent. However, it is dovish on maximum employment, as there is no fixed numerical goal. Therefore, the sentence suggests a mixed or neutral approach to US monetary policy.

sentence: That is because the level of maximum employment depends on "nonmonetary factors that affect the structure and dynamics of the labor market," which can change in important ways over time.3The recognition that maximum employment evolves over time to reflect changes in the economic landscape serves us well.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It acknowledges that the level of maximum employment is influenced by nonmonetary factors and can change over time. The recognition of this evolution is important for guiding policy decisions, indicating a balanced and adaptable approach.

sentence: It puts the onus on members of the FOMC to analyze the changing features of the labor market and develop a nuanced understanding of the different margins of slack.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy as it emphasizes the responsibility of FOMC members to analyze the labor market and understand various aspects of slack. It implies a proactive approach towards tightening monetary policy based on labor market conditions.

sentence: This approach to maximum employment has allowed the FOMC to navigate the current recovery in a way that has likely brought more people back into productive employment than might have been the case with a fixed, aggregate unemployment-rate target based on pre-crisis norms, in effect, achieving more inclusive growth.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The FOMC's approach to maximum employment has been effective in bringing more people back into productive employment, indicating a focus on inclusive growth rather than a fixed unemployment-rate target based on pre-crisis norms.

sentence: This is especially true at a time when the traditional Phillips curve relationship between unemployment and inflation is extremely flat for reasons we do not fully understand.When we disaggregate the economy-wide labor market statistics, we often find significant and persistent racial disparities.4 For many decades, the unemployment rate of African Americans has been nearly double the national unemployment rate, with little indication that the relative difference is narrowing or that it can be fully accounted for by education or sectoral mix; the unemployment rate for Hispanics also has consistently been higher than the national unemployment rate.5 Similarly, during the Great Recession, the unemployment rates of African Americans and Hispanics rose more sharply and rapidly than for workers as a whole.6 Even though the unemployment rates of these groups are back around their pre-recession levels, they remain higher than the national average.
reason: This sentence highlights the persistent racial disparities in the labor market, particularly for African Americans and Hispanics. It suggests that the traditional Phillips curve relationship between unemployment and inflation is extremely flat, which implies that the relationship between these factors may not be as influential as previously thought. This information is relevant to US monetary policy as it indicates the need for a more nuanced approach that considers these disparities. However, it does not directly indicate a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: We can also see persistent disparities by gender, such as the well-known wage premium earned by men relative to women with similar experience and expertise.7 With its focus on inclusive growth, this Institute could give us important insights on how far the overall economy is from full employment, as well as the barriers that could be limiting the economy's potential, by studying labor market outcomes of men and women of different racial and ethnic backgrounds in more depth.8Research on the drivers of disparities in labor market outcomes can also help the Federal Reserve better assess potential tradeoffs in monetary policy.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy. It discusses disparities by gender and the importance of studying labor market outcomes, but it does not provide any direct implications or insights on whether the monetary policy should be hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: In meetings with community groups, we often hear from advocates who point to the stark discrepancy they see between the economy's aggregate U-3 unemployment rate, which many forecasters estimate to be at or approaching full employment, and the much higher rates of unemployment among the people in their neighborhoods.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the concerns of community groups regarding the discrepancy between the aggregate U-3 unemployment rate and the higher rates of unemployment in their neighborhoods. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: For instance, Rod Adams, a neighborhood advocate here in Minneapolis, noted the unemployment rate for African Americans locally was still almost 9 percent late last summer and observed that "if the labor market were truly healthy, people in my community would all be able to find full-time jobs at decent wages.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the unemployment rate for African Americans in Minneapolis. It does not provide any information or implications related to the monetary policy stance, therefore it is not hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: "9 While the policy tools available to the Federal Reserve are not well suited to addressing the barriers that contribute to persistent disparities in the labor market outcomes of different groups, understanding these barriers and efforts to address them is vital in assessing maximum employment as well as potential growth.The Federal Reserve's community development work is invaluable in supporting our efforts to understand and improve the labor market experiences of different groups.10 For instance, during the Great Recession, workforce development organizations in Atlanta found themselves overwhelmed by the sharp rise in unemployment, which highlighted the need for a better connected and stronger network of job training and placement services.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the Federal Reserve's community development work and the need for a better network of job training and placement services. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: I recently spent time with these organizations, along with community members and some of our Atlanta staff, who have been working on the creation of the Metro Atlanta eXchange (or MAX) for Workforce Solutions, the region's only comprehensive directory for workforce development services.Just as there is a connection between maximum employment and inclusive growth, so, too, there is an important connection between potential output and opportunity.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Reserve. It focuses on the creation of a workforce development directory and emphasizes the connection between potential output and opportunity, which is unrelated to monetary policy.

sentence: If there are large disparities in opportunity based on geography or race or gender, such that households' enterprise, exertion, and investments are not rewarded commensurately, then families and small businesses will invest less in the future and potential growth will fall short.11 Indeed, one worrisome trend is the decline in the labor force participation of prime-age workers with less education, a trend that has been going on for decades among men and that has more recently begun to be mirrored in the participation rate of women.12 Understanding this growing detachment from work is important to improving both opportunity and potential growth.In visits to Detroit, Milwaukee, North St. Louis, and Baltimore, I have heard from residents and community organizations about the challenging barriers standing between the many workers seeking jobs and the many jobs seeking workers.
reason: This sentence highlights the disparities in opportunity based on geography, race, and gender, which can lead to reduced investment and potential growth. It emphasizes the worrisome trend of declining labor force participation among workers with less education, affecting both men and women. The mention of challenging barriers in specific cities indicates a need for addressing these issues. The implications of this sentence on US monetary policy are irrelevant as it does not directly relate to the stance of monetary policy or its impact on interest rates.

sentence:
The local barriers separating jobs from job seekers can be as concrete as the physical isolation created by major traffic arteries or poorly designed transit systems.13 I have visited Los Angeles, where our staff have been actively engaged with businesses, transit authorities, and community groups in efforts around "equitable transit-oriented development" so that public transit systems are designed to enhance access for low- and moderate-income residents.14Household Financial Health
Inclusion and opportunity also figure prominently in our work on financial resilience.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the FOMC's work on financial resilience and inclusion, which does not directly impact the decision-making process regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: While the resilience of the financial system has long been central to Federal Reserve policy, in recent years we have come to more fully appreciate that a resilient financial system rests on the foundations of financially resilient households and businesses.The ability to manage the ups and downs in family income and expenses without hardship and the ability to make sound investments for the future are both crucial to financial health.
reason: This sentence suggests that the Federal Reserve has recognized the importance of financially resilient households and businesses in maintaining a resilient financial system. It implies a dovish stance as it emphasizes the need for stability and the ability to manage economic fluctuations without hardship.

sentence: Yet we see from the latest edition of the Federal Reserve's Survey of Household Economics and Decisionmaking (SHED) that a strikingly high 40 percent of American households with high school degrees or less report that they are struggling financially.15 And the in-depth research in the U.S. Financial Diaries Project provides insights into the large amount of time and effort these families with thin financial buffers must devote to managing their volatile cash flows.16A seemingly modest mismatch between income and expenses can threaten to send the finances of some families into a downward spiral from which it can be expensive and difficult to recover.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the financial struggles of American households with low education levels. It does not provide any indication of the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) or its implications on monetary policy.

sentence: The results of the 2016 SHED show that nearly one-fourth of all households are unable to pay their current month's bills in full, nearly one-third would rely on borrowing or selling something to cover a $400 emergency expense, and one in eight would not be able to cover a $400 emergency expense by any means.
reason: This sentence from the FOMC is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the financial situation of households rather than providing any indication of the committee's stance. It does not provide any hawkish, dovish, or neutral implications.

sentence: Over half of households lack savings to cover three months' expenses if they lost their main source of income.17 This finding corroborates the evidence found in the financial diaries of low- to moderate-income families that show it is all too common for households to have no short-term savings to cover emergencies.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the lack of savings among households. While it highlights a concerning financial situation, it does not directly impact the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: According to the Survey of Consumer Finances, on average from 1989 to 2013, about 80 percent of households in the bottom quintile of the income distribution had less than $3,000 adjusted for inflation in liquid assets (cash, checking, or savings accounts).
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it provides information about the financial situation of households in the bottom quintile of the income distribution, but does not directly address the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: Even among households in the middle quintile of income, about half do not meet this threshold for liquid assets.In addition, the financial crisis demonstrated that household financial imbalances can have important consequences for overall financial stability in extreme circumstances.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses household financial imbalances and their impact on overall financial stability, without directly addressing the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) or its implications on monetary policy.

sentence: The rapid and widespread rise in poorly underwritten mortgage debt prior to the Great Recession is widely viewed as a key contributor to the financial crisis.18 This suggests the potential value of better understanding the specific patterns in household finances that would give an early warning of a crisis.

sentence: In carrying out our responsibilities to monitor and safeguard the stability of the financial system, although much of the work has focused on marketwide risks, core financial institutions, and macro-level shocks, we are also developing a more granular understanding of the distribution and strength of household balance sheets.19 Progress on this frontier is being aided by greater access to timely, account-level, and geographically specific data on consumer credit, mortgages, and spending, although more research in this area would be valuable.Slower income growth, as well as substantial volatility in income, has raised the financial stress faced by low- and moderate-income families and may be limiting absolute mobility across generations.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the monitoring and safeguarding of the financial system, understanding household balance sheets, and the financial stress faced by low- and moderate-income families. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Over time, the "American Dream" that each generation can expect to be better off than their parents' generation has gone from being widespread to increasingly out of reach for much of the population.20 Researchers have found that the reduction in economic mobility has been driven primarily by a more unequal distribution of economic growth, with slower overall gross domestic product (GDP) growth a secondary factor.21Many households had been contending with volatile incomes even before the large negative shocks of the Great Recession and the increase in contingent work arrangements (and the "gig" economy).22 23 Unpredictable income and dangerously low emergency savings raise the strain on households and, over time, have pushed them to rely on other means, such as borrowing and government transfers, to try to meet their spending needs.24Education and homeownership have long been key paths to opportunity, but the Great Recession has raised some important questions about asset building strategies.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the challenges faced by households in achieving economic mobility and asset building strategies. It does not provide any direct implications on whether the monetary policy should be hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: The sharp decline in house prices and the substantial rise in student loan debt have made it clear that investments in homeownership and education are not without risk, and the payoff can vary depending on the circumstances.25Homeownership for many has been a way to turn a regular expense into an asset-building investment in the future, which is especially important given the wide and persistent disparities in wealth by race and ethnicity.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The acknowledgment of the risks associated with investments in homeownership and education implies a cautious approach. Additionally, the mention of wealth disparities highlights the need for policies that promote inclusivity and economic stability, aligning with a dovish stance.

sentence: But the experience of the past decade suggests that owning a home can, in some circumstances, exacerbate financial difficulties for vulnerable families in a downturn.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the potential negative impact of owning a home on vulnerable families during an economic downturn. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: The lesson that even a moderate decline in house prices can erase home equity applies broadly, along with the importance of sound underwriting and servicing, but the painful consequences in the recession were greater among minority and low-income homeowners.26 The fact, discussed earlier, that African American and Hispanic homeowners households are more likely to lose their jobs in a recession and are also more likely to live in neighborhoods with concentrated job loss led to even larger house price declines and more foreclosures among these households.27 Indeed, there are many low-income neighborhoods in which many homeowners remain "underwater" on their mortgages even today.Community development organizations are putting this more nuanced view of asset building into practice and thereby increasing opportunities for individuals to make smart investments in their future.

It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Better Family Life, a community group I visited in North St. Louis, provides would-be homebuyers with education and counseling on how to manage the costs of homeownership, tools to navigate real estate markets, and information on lending.28 There is ample research demonstrating that housing counseling makes a notable improvement in the likelihood that asset building through homeownership will pay off for first-time buyers in low- to moderate-income communities.29Similarly, under the right circumstances, education can be a critical investment in the future and a path to opportunity, leading to higher wages and improved financial outcomes.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the benefits of housing counseling and education on financial outcomes. It does not provide any indication of the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) or its implications on US monetary policy.

sentence: Over the past several decades, the earnings premium for those with a college degree relative to those with a high school education has risen substantially, making higher education, on average, even more valuable.30Nonetheless, even though education is a sound investment for most students, the benefits can vary with the quality and type of education received.31 The SHED finds that fewer than 40 percent of nongraduates or graduates from for-profit institutions say their education was "worth the cost," compared with two-thirds of graduates from public or nonprofit institutions.32 The downsides from such low-return education are compounded for those who took out student loans, in some cases leaving them worse off than before.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the implications of education on individuals' earnings and student loans. It does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) on monetary policy.

sentence: As an indication of this problem, nearly three-fourths of recent borrowers who attended for-profit schools failed to make progress on paying off their student loans in the first few years, and almost half were in default within five years.33 Investments in education that do not pay off can set these individuals back on asset building as well as on other life goals they may have.

sentence:
To advance more inclusive growth and opportunity, it is essential to help people, especially first-time and nontraditional college students, access smarter educational investments with more reliable and better returns.34Communities of Opportunity
The connection between the conditions in a community and individual opportunity has been demonstrated in powerful research that many of you have pioneered, and we see this connection every day in our work in communities around the country.
